channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: SHC Offering Free Flu Shot Clinic for Students November 19
item.description: The Student Health Center will be holding a final flu shot clinic to students on Tuesday, November 19 from 10:30 AM to 5:00 PM in the DCC hallway. No appointment necessary; just stop by with your student ID!
item.author: Students

item.title: Dr. Scott Oshiro to Lead Quantum Music Workshop
item.description: Join HASS at 5:00PM on November 21 in Sage 2510 for this hands-on workshop, which offers an introduction to quantum computing with a focus on developing computer music applications. The workshop will cover various building blocks and fundamentals of quantum computing, followed by sections on quantum algorithms and how they are used in current quantum computer music applications.
item.author: Students

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: Therapy Dog Group Sessions to Continue November 20
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Register to join other students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Looking for an Apartment?
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn about how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Foundation Housing, Off-Campus Commons to Co-Host Housing Info Session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 11:30 AM - 2:00 PM - Foundation Housing and Off-Campus Commons are excited to give students this opportunity to meet Associate Dean of Off-Campus Commons Graham Knowles, ask questions, and explore what makes Foundation houses an ideal off-campus living option for students. What’s more, Foundation Housing has partnered with Chipotle and Chick-fil-A to offer free food to students while they get all the details on Foundation Housing options for next year!
item.author: Students

item.title: Gateway Shuttles to be Available for Thanksgiving Holiday
item.description: Rensselaer’s Department of Parking and Transportation is pleased to announce that it will once again be offering Gateway shuttle transportation to and from regional destination points — including the Albany International Airport, Albany bus terminal, and the Amtrak train station — for the upcoming Thanksgiving holiday. All reservations must be received by Wednesday, November 20, so be sure to sign up ASAP!
item.author: Students

item.title: Fall Meeting of the Astronomical Society of New York Slated for November 23
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 23, 2024 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Physics Professor Robles is hosting the 2024 Fall Meeting of the Astronomical Society of New York, and all are welcome to attend for exciting astronomy-themed talks and poster presentations in the CBIS Isermann Auditorium.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Apple Appreciation Sale Offering 10% Off
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store will hold an Apple appreciation sale from Monday, November 18 until Friday, November 22, with select Apple items 10% off. Please note that this offer is available online only, so be sure to shop on our website! Sale prices will automatically display for all qualifying items.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Music Lecture with Dr. Scott Oshiro Slated for November 22
item.description: Come to Sage 3303 at 5:00PM on November 22 for a lecture with Bay Area-based flautist and music technology researcher Dr. Scott Oshiro as he discusses ongoing research into the use of quantum computers for creating and understanding music. As an African and Okinawan American, Scott’s creative and academic work incorporates influences from his heritage and combines them with jazz, hip hop, and electronic music.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum One Computer Scheduled for Maintenance November 20
item.description: The Quantum One computer will be down for a system upgrade on Wednesday, November 20 from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM ET.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics & Astronomy/ECSE to Hold Joint Colloquium
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Co-hosted by Rensselaer’s departments of Physics, Applied Physics & Astronomy and Electrical, Computer, and Systems Engineering, this colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Near Research Opportunities of III-Nitride Semiconductors: From Artificial Photosynthesis to Ferroelectricity” by Prof. Zetian Mi, of the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor.
item.author: Community

item.title: Nutrition Workshop to be Held November 21
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center classroom for a program that focuses on colorful and mindful eating! For more information, please stop by the Mueller Center or contact Lauren Arnoff.
item.author: Community

item.title: BME Seminar Series Continues November 21
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Hyperspectral imaging (HSI) is an emerging modality for medical applications such as cancer detection and diagnosis, image-guided surgery, and computational and digital pathology. In this talk, Professor Baowei Fei will discuss various hyperspectral imaging technologies and present their medical and biological applications, focusing on how deep learning methods are applied to HSI and how HSI techniques are developed for image-guided surgery.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar Series to Continue November 20
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Advancing lithium battery technology through materials science, design and manufacturing” by Dr. Chengcheng Fang, of the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science at Michigan State University.
item.author: Community

item.title: Virtual URP Handshake Faculty Training to be Held November 21
item.description:
From 2:00PM to 3:00PM on Thursday, November 21, the CCPD will host an opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. If you can’t make it to this session but would like to be notified of future trainings, please contact Nicole Doran.
